intro: Desmodium terminale, commonly known as hairy beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pods that contain small, round seeds, which are often covered in fine hairs. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it an important plant in soil enrichment and ecological restoration.
